intro: Phragmanthera irebuensis, commonly known as the Irebuen's phragmanthera, is a rare flowering plant native to the highland regions of Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and purple. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in montane forests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered vulnerable and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
